meanings.definition: A person or thing that dwarfs.
meanings.sent1: The tall tree stood next to the dwarfer bush.
meanings.sent2: The skyscraper was a dwarfer compared to the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The dwarfer squirrel tried to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: In the land of giants, he felt like a dwarfer among them.
meanings.sent5: The dwarfer ship looked tiny next to the massive cruise liner.

meanings.sent1: The new building will dwarfer the old one.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the tree will dwarfer the fence.
meanings.sent3: The magician's spell accidentally caused the hat to dwarfer.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the mountain dwarfered the entire valley.
meanings.sent5: The giant's presence dwarfered everything around him.

meanings.sent1: The dwarfer rock was easier to lift than the boulder.
meanings.sent2: She chose the dwarfer pumpkin from the patch.
meanings.sent3: The dwarfer chair was perfect for the little kitten.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded dwarfer compared to the booming thunder.
meanings.sent5: The dwarfer flower stood out among the tall grass.
